info.description: API Gateway user can do basic CRUD operations on resources like Api, Application, Package and Plans and so on without any supervision. But if the user wants to restrict the basic CRUD operations then they can use Approval Configuration. Once the user enabled approval configuration for respective events then without accepting/rejecting the approval request nothing will take place. API Gateway Approval Management Service allows user to manage the different types of approval configuration in API Gateway. Any user with the 'Manage general administration configurations' functional privilege can manage the Approval configuration. Any user as part of Approval Team can approve or reject the Approval requests. By default, the users who are part of 'Administrators' Team will have this privilege. Any user with the 'Manage applications' functional privilege can approve or reject the Approval request but they can't delete it. The approval request can be deleted by the one who created it or the one who has 'Manage general administration configurations' functional privilege. Available approval configuration events are 1. Create application, 2. Register application, 3. Update application, 4. Subscribe package and 5. Change owner/teams. Once user enabled any of the event then the respective operation will not happen without approving the request. For example if user enables Create application Approval configuration, then while creating application any of the user in the Approver Team need to approve the application creation approval request to create the application. Until then users can't view the application in the Applications page. This is the same with the other configurations also. In addition to that user can enable send notification option to send notification via email to approver for 1. Approval initiation, 2. Accepting approval and 3. Rejecting Approval. User can also configure the email template for the events to be sent to the approver. To send email to the approvers, users need to configure the Email under Administration -> Destinations-> Email configuration.
info.title: API Gateway Approvals Management Service

get.description: The method retrieves a list of available approval configurations in API Gateway.

200.description: This status code indicates that a list of the available approval configurations is retrieved successfully.

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to access this API.

post.description: The method creates an approval configuration in API Gateway.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: This parameter describes the request payload of an approval configuration that is to be created in API Gateway.

200.description: This status code indicates that the approval configuration has been successfully created in API Gateway.

400.description: This status code indicates that the given approval configuration request body is not correct.

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to access this API.

500.description: This status code indicates that server has encountered an error during the creation of approval configuration.

get.description: The method retrieves the details of a specified approval configuration in API Gateway

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: This parameter specifies the ID of an approval configuration whose details are to be retrieved in API Gateway.

200.description: This status code indicates that the details of the specified approval configuration are retrieved successfully.

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to access this API.

404.description: This status code indicates that an approval configuration with the given ID could not be found in API Gateway.

put.description: The method updates the approval configuration in API Gateway.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: This parameter describes the request payload of an approval configuration that is to be updated in API Gateway.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: This parameter specifies the ID of an approval configuration that is to be updated in API Gateway.

200.description: This status code indicates that the approval configuration has been successfully updated in API Gateway.

400.description: This status code indicates that the given approval configuration request body is not correct.

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to access this API.

404.description: This status code indicates that an approval configuration with the given ID could not be found in API Gateway.

500.description: This status code indicates that server has encountered an error during the update of approval configuration.

delete.description: The method deletes the specified approval configuration in API Gateway.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: This parameter specifies the ID of an approval configuration that is to be deleted in API Gateway.

204.description: This status code indicates that the specified approval configuration has been successfully deleted from API Gateway.

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to access this API.

404.description: This status code indicates that an approval configuration with the given ID could not be found in API Gateway.

get.description: Retrieve all the approval requests waiting for the user. If the user is part of one or more approval team, then he/she will get the approval requests assigned for those teams.

200.description: The method provides all approval requests pending for the user

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to access this API.

get.description: Retrieve an Approval Request based on the approvalId.

parameters.name: approvalId
parameters.description: approvalId for the Approval Request to be retrieved

200.description: This method provides the details of approval request.

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to access this API.

404.description: This status code indicates that the approvalId specified is not found in the API Gateway

delete.description: Delete the Approval Request with the given approvalId

parameters.name: approvalId
parameters.description: Approval Request Id for the Approval Request to be deleted

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to access this API.

404.description: This status code indicates that the approvalId specified is not found in the API Gateway

put.description: Request payload for the approval request.

parameters.name: approvalId
parameters.description: ApprovalId for the Approval Request to be approved

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Action for the Approval Request to be approved/rejected

200.description: Response payload of the approval request after approve/reject action.

400.description: This status code indicates that the given approval request body is not correct.

401.description: This status code indicates that either user didn't provide right credentials or user doesn't have required privileges to access this API.

404.description: This status code indicates that the approvalId specified is not found in the API Gateway

500.description: This status code indicates that server has encountered an error during the update of approval request.

Basic.description: API Gateway Administrator and API Gateway provider

approvalMode.description: Only possible value is anyone. This implies that, any one user associated with the approvers team can approve or reject the requests. The requester need not wait for the approval of each approver in the approvers group.

approversGroupId.description: Approvers Accessprofile Identifier. Whoever belongs to the selected team will be considered as Approvers

autoApproval.description: The created request will be auto-approved when the requester is a valid approver and the value is true. Default value is true.

id.description: Unique identifier of a Approval Configuration. Any of 'createApplication', 'updateApplication', 'registerApplication', 'subscribePackage' and 'changeOwner'

isEnabled.description: true/false. true value enforces approvals for the mentioned eventtype

owningTeamApprovalRequired.description: The asset specific team approvers will be the approvers when the value is true. Default value is false.

ApprovalConfiguration.description: This model contains details about an ApprovalConfiguration in API Gateway

approversGroupId.description: Approvers Accessprofile Identifier. Whoever belongs to the selected team will be considered as Approvers

mode.description: Mode of the request approval and 'anyone' is the only allowed value

requestorFirstName.description: First name of the requestor user name

requestorLastName.description: Last name of the requestor user name

enabled.description: true/false. Email would be sent to user only when enabled value is true.

requestType.description: Request Type. Value would be any of initiated, approved or rejected.

EmailConfiguration.description: This model contains details about an EmailConfiguration configured in Approvals of API Gateway
